intro: Gymnopsis euxenioides, commonly known as the Mexican burr plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces spherical, spiny fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Gymnopsis euxenioides is often found in disturbed areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
